addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

4th October
1589
From M
r
Bodley.
rec
o
mendeth one for rec
o
pense of services, promised as is suggested, at
e mediation of Skenk.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. The bearer herof pre-
tendeth to have done speciall service to her
Ma
tie
and suche as is knowen to yo
r
H. for whiche he
hath bin certified,
at her Hig
nes
at
e instance of
S
r
Martin Schincke, ordened a reward to be deli-
vered Unto him. Divers of his frindes, whiche
are heere of good account, have bin earnest w
t
me, to procure him so muche favor from yo
w
,
at
if her Ma
tie
hath used any suche consideration
towardes him, by yo
r
honorable meanes he may
come to have notice of it, and enjoy
e benefit
whether he hath bin thus truly informed, or doth
but helpe himself by this pollicie, to gette accesse
to make his petition, I can not perceave. But
he seemeth very ready, if yo
r
H. please, and
have any imploiment for him, to adventure
againe into
e Enemies contrey. He hath
had conference about
e cause of this his voiage w
t
Barnevelt
and some others, whose speeches and wri-
tinges, w
ch
this bearer can signifie and shewe to yo
r
H. were most malitious. For they suppose in a
letter, whereof he can showe
e copy,
at her Ma
tie
gave
order for some recompense but
at it was detened
from him, wheruppon
if
at were true,
they say, it is to be doubted
at
e Englishe men will reject his request, and
lay
it
on
e neckes of those of
Holland,
w
t
out her
Ma
ties
privitie. It may please yo
r
H. to see
e
letter, and likewise to peruse his remonstrance,
and to understand w
at
he will further impart,
w
ch
I leave to be considered by yo
r
H. and take
my humble leave. Oc
t
4. 89 Hage.
Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
